text: Ezio Pascutti (1 June 1937 - 4 January 2017) was an Italian football manager and player. He has played for Italy's national team. ==Death== Pascutti died under hospice care in Bologna, Italy on 4 January 2017 from a "serious illness", aged 79. ==Club career statistics== |- |1955-56||rowspan="14"|Bologna||rowspan="14"|Serie A||18||11 |- |1956-57||27||11 |- |1957-58||26||12 |- |1958-59||31||17 |- |1959-60||18||8 |- |1960-61||13||4 |- |1961-62||28||11 |- |1962-63||18||14 |- |1963-64||25||8 |- |1964-65||26||7 |- |1965-66||22||10 |- |1966-67||21||10 |- |1967-68||20||7 |- |1968-69||3||0 296||130 296||130 |} ==International career statistics== |- |1958||1||0 |- |1959||0||0 |- |1960||0||0 |- |1961||0||0 |- |1962||3||2 |- |1963||1||0 |- |1964||2||2 |- |1965||5||2 |- |1966||4||2 |- |1967||1||0 |- !Total||17||8 |} ==References== Category:1937 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Footballers from Friuli-Venezia Giulia Category:Italian football managers
